Package server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • tage.networking.AbstractGameConnection
      • tage.networking.server.AbstractGameConnectionServer<K>
        • tage.networking.server.GameConnectionServer<java.util.UUID>
          • server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    tage.networking.IGameConnection, tage.networking.server.IGameConnectionServer
    public class Server
extends tage.networking.server.GameConnectionServer<java.util.UUID>
    connects multiple clients together for multiplayer games. Also controls NPC AI.

    • Method Detail

      • processPacket

        public void processPacket​(java.lang.Object o,
                          java.net.InetAddress senderIP,
                          int sndPort)
        Description copied from class: tage.networking.server.GameConnectionServer
        Responsible for processing a single packet received by the server. Method provides the sender's address and sender's port. This method should be overridden to implement the game specific protocol.
        Specified by:
        processPacket in interface tage.networking.server.IGameConnectionServer
        Overrides:
        processPacket in class tage.networking.server.GameConnectionServer<java.util.UUID>
        Parameters:
        o - object received by the server
        senderIP - sender's address
        sndPort - sender's port

        public void sendCreateMessages​(java.util.UUID clientID,
                               java.lang.String[] position)
        sends a message to all connected clients to create a new ghost avatar
        Parameters:
        clientID - id of new player (used to block sending the message to them)
        position - avatar location

      • npcLoop

        public void npcLoop()
        this is the NPC AI loop. There are 4 possible outcomes: 1. If already flying, do nothing 2. if not flying, but an avatar is close, start flying 3. if walking, stop walking. 4. if a 50% chance succeeds, start walking
